RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 20000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PATIO'S PORCH vied for the lead, took the rail, set the pace, was never challenged and won easily. MYGLORYBEE was off mid pack and racing on the rail, edged out along the back side into the three path, launched a bid at the three eights pole and angled out into the six path, was asked at the quarter pole and responded well finding his best stride late closing well and gaining ground quickly, needed more time and ground. SPARKIN vied for the lead, then ended up stalking the pace from the three path, followed the leader through the turn and chased down the stretch, could not get tot the winner but was second best today. PUNCHIE stalked the pace from the four path, raced between foes, was hand ridden i n the turn and encouraged, improved position sligthtly, then ran even down the lane. CHARLIE'S PARADE was a bit keen on the bit but still in a stalking position early on, raced three to four wide down the back stretch, launched a bid at the three eights pole and edged out into the four path, made a move to circle the field, spooked at horses to the inside, steadied, regained composure and raced into the stretch in the six path and finished even. SERRANO'S WARRIOR vied for the lead, then stalked on the rail, and gave way by the three eights pole. ROCK SOLID WORDS was bumped by foes on both side at the start, raced on the rail but had no impact. SAUCER EYES raced from off of the pace angled out five wide through the turn but to no avail. SNAKEBIT trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Myglorybee
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, bid 3/8, shifted out 6w, circled, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Solid Words
ENTRY.OWNER: Eleven One Racing Stables LLC (Kevin Roberts)

ENTRY.NAME: Saucer Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace angled 5 wide, turn no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie's Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen, stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, circled 4w, spooked, steadied, even

ENTRY.NAME: Patio's Porch
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied led, rail, pace, went unchallenged,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Filly and Mare Sprint S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 93. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED FILLIES AND MARES, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Free nomination. $250 to pass the entry box and an additional $250 to start. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 G uaranteed of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three Years Old 120 lbs - Older 124 lbs. Non-winners of $30,000 in 2023 allowed 2lbs; two races other maiden, claiming or starter in 2023 allowed 4lb s; a race other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2023 allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than Twelve (12) pass the entry box, preference will be given to the horses with the highest earnings in 2022 - 2023. Different owners will have equal draw accor ding to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw into the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Monday July 24, 2023w
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NORAH G vied for the lead, took the rail, set the pace, was in hands with stalkers right off of her, showed the way into the stretch from the fence, past the quarter pole was asked and kept on point, turned back any who tried to challenge and took the win commandingly. FINAL QUEST was off mid pack, raced in between horses four wide, maintained her position until the eighth pole, shifted out seven wide and closed well getting up for second place honors. MISS PRIORITY vied for the lead, stalked the leader from the leaders hip, stayed on with the leader until the furlong ground then was caught late by an outside closing rival, settling for third place. ZYDECO MUSIC was off a bit slow, raced on the inside in the two path, saved ground through out, shifted out a bit in the upper stretch, then shifted back inside while closing ground. NONEYA raced in the middle of the field, raced between horses in the two path, maintained position, then closed with a mild bid late. LAKE MARIE vied for the lead, shuffled back into a stalking position, stalked from the three path, was wide through the turn, and had no rally late. ROYAL O'HAIGAIN ran from off of the pace in the two path, and finished with an even effort. FREE LIKE A GIRL was off of the pace early, stayed to the outside racing in the seven path, improved position slightly down the back side, was mid pack through the turn, was cued at the top of the lane but showed little. SPIRITED BEAUTY missed the break, raced on the rail, passed tired ones late. FIRST I'VE SEEN made no impact. BELEOUT was mid pack in the two path, saved ground through out and gave way in the stretch. HALFPRICED was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Norah G
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, in hands, cued, kept to task,winner

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, stalked, 2w, just missed for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Final Quest
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, between, maintained, shifted out 7w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Beleout
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack ,2w, saved ground, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Zydeco Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 2w, inside, split, saved ground, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Royal O'Haigain
ENTRY.OWNER: Pappas Horse Racing Corp and Bartlett Charles

ENTRY.NAME: Noneya
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack between, mild bid late

ENTRY.NAME: Free Like a Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Jr Gerald Deville Carl J Pomier Chasey Deville and Caroom Jerry

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Distaff S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED FILLIES AND MARES, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Free nomination. $250 to pass the entry box and an additional $250 to start. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 G uaranteed of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three years old 120lbs; Older 124lbs. Non-winners of $30,000 at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2lbs; two races other than maiden, claiming or starter at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 4lbs; a race other than maiden, claiming or starter at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than twelve (12) pass the entry box, preference will be given to the horse with the highest earnings in 2 022 - 2023. Different owners will have equal draw according to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw into the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to thew
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAR MOMENT stalked the pace from the two path, saved ground racing on the inside, stayed tucked behind the leaders through the turn, patiently waited for her cue, finally was asked at the eighth pole, she responded well, willingly exploding into another gear and charging home, ambushing the front runners, taking the win and everyone by surprise. BIRDIE CALL vied for the lead, led while racing on the rail, did all of the work up front, was merely a few strides to the wire and was caught late settling for second. WHOLELOTTAMO raced from the middle of the field, stayed to the inside advancing up the rail, launched a bid at the half mile pole, continued to gain ground on the inside, moved into the a bad spot going into the turn,, clipped heels with a rival in front of her switching leads traveling into the turn, was thrown off balance, had to re gain her stride and was able t finish third. EVE'S DELIGHT vied for the lead, raced on the rail, stalked the pace, then gave way. A G'S CHARLOTTE raced mid pack and in the three path, finished even. CHEAPSKATE DIVA stalked the pace, raced the three wide, launched a bid at the half mile pole, was in contention but had no kick. FORT POLK raced off of the pace, was four wide and made no impact. LOUISIANA LIBERTY was off a bit slow, raced in the four path while trailing the field, improved position, was widest in the stretch and had no finish. MO BLING was mid pack and in between horses funning in the three path, but could never get involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Polk
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L

ENTRY.NAME: Eve's Delight
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, staked, rail, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Louisiana Liberty
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, 4 wide, improved position, no finish

ENTRY.NAME: Star Moment
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w. inside, saved ground, bid 1/8, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Birdie Call
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 3w, caught late, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Bling
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, between, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Wholelottamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, bid 1/2, saved ground, clipped heels, recovered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Juvenile S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED TWO YEAR OLD COLTS AND GELDINGS. Free nomination. $250 to pass the entry box and an additional $250 to start. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 Guaranteed of w hich 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 119 lbs. Non-winners of $30,000 allowed 2 lbs. A race other than maiden or claiming 4 lbs. Maidens are allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than Twelve (12) pass th e entry box, preference will be given to the horses with the highest lifetime earnings. Different owners will have equal draw according to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw i nto the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Monday July 24, 2023 with 24 Nominees.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRONG PROMISE raced in the middle of the field early, was in the three path and traveling nicely, cooley maintained position until the furlong ground, was given the cue and easily went to the front dominating this field.. GOOD AND STOUT stalked the pace, raced on the rail, saved ground, challenged for the lead at the quarter pole, took command, led into the furlong ground, then was caught late. EL DINERO was off a touch slow, raced in between rivals, stayed in the three path as he improved position, gained ground, was in contention in the stretch drive, was no match for the first two finishers but did out finish the rest earning a good third. DEAL WITH IT DADDY was off in mid pack, raced in the four path, shifted into the eight path in the upper stretch and raced an even race. A THOUSAND DOLLARS ivied for the lead, raced in the two path, was in a set, inched in front and led, then tired in the stretch. C D'S WILD FIRE raced in the middle of the field, stayed o the rail, saved ground through out, not enough today. RISING KOTO STAR vied for the lead, was forwardly placed racing between horses, shuffled back and lost ground, got him self together and re rallied in the stretch. BRADFIELD BABY trailed early was never involved. WESTERN AFLEET vied, led, 2w, steadied at the five sixteenth pole, lost all his momentum and stopped. MAJESTIC PALACE was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: C D's Wild Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, not enough today

ENTRY.NAME: Good and Stout
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, saved ground, challenged 1/4, led, caught, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Bradfield Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Bockmon Danny and Joey Foster Racing and Farm LLC

ENTRY.NAME: El Dinero
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, between, 3w, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Palace
ENTRY.OWNER: Madison Stewart Mather and Ward Ronnie P

ENTRY.NAME: Rising Koto Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, between, shuffled back, re rallied late

ENTRY.NAME: Deal With It Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, 8 wide, upper, raced even

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Promise
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, improved turn, bid 1/8, dominant

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 84. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile O r Over Since July 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Condition eligibility preferred. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONEFORVIVI raced in the middle of the pack early on, traveled in the two path, improved position, stalked the leaders into the furlong ground, was asked and responded by passing rivals in the last strides getting up in time for the win. CAJUN EDDIE stalked the front runner in the two path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was pushed and hand ridden in the turn, started to gain momentum, was driven in the lane, hooked an outside also closing rival, closed in a set drawing closer to the leader, drew beside the leader putting CAJUN EDDIE in between foes battling for the win, he hesitated just a hair, lost half a stride, finishing second. RIPITTOTHERIGHT stalked the pace from the three path, maintained that position until the eighth pole, challenged for the lead, took command and led briefly, was collared by a set of outside closers, battled and came up short for the win, but still a good third. THROWIN' SHADE was mid pack and racing on the rail, saved ground, launched a bid at the three eights pole, gained ground through the turn, closed up the fence in the stretch, was encouraged and driven, gained ground with every stride. SABER RUN was off of the pace and three wide, launched a bid at the three eights pole, but to no avail. GOOD OLD CHARLIE was off of the pace in the early stages, raced three wide, launched a bid at the half, improved position, was three wide in the upper stretch and closed well. WAR COUNT vied for the lead, stayed on the fence, set the fractions, then gave way. DUDE DROP KID trailed the field early in the two path, put in a mild bid late. ZION raced from off of the pace, stayed on the rail and made no impact. INTO WISHING showed little. HEZA PRIORITY was no threat. AMAVI was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Oneforvivi
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, improved, stalked, bid 1/16, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Eddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, bid 3/8, pushed, driven, split, hesitated. 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Dude Drop Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Charles C. and John Dirik, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Zion
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Throwin' Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, bid 3/8, saved ground, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Saber Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3 wide, bid 3/8, to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Ripittotheright
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, challenged, led, battled, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Juvenile Fillies S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED TWO YEAR OLD FILLIES. Free nomination. $250 to pass the entry box and an additional $250 to start. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 Guaranteed of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 119 lbs. Non-winners $30,000 allowed 2lbs. A race other than maiden or claiming 4 lbs. Maidens are allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than Twelve (12) pass the entry box, pr eference will be given to the horses with the highest lifetime earnings. Different owners have equal draw according to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw into the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Monday July 24, 2023 with 26 Nominees.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAP GALORE was off in the middle of the filed, raced on the rail, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field in the turn on the inside of another rival, working as a set, shifted into the five path in the upper stretch, closed well getting up in time. DIAMOND DEAL stalked the pace setter from the four path, launched a bid at the three eights pole, circled the field through the turn and took the lead at the quarter pole, led into the furlong ground, was joined by her stable mate, raced in company for a few strides then tired, but impressively held on for second. VIV'S WILD ACES raced from the middle of the pack, was racing on the outside of other rivals while advancing into a stalking position, shifted into the five path and launched a bid at the three eighths pole, gained ground through the turn, could not sustain the bid to get to the winner but was better than the rest. RUNNING ARGUMENT vied for the lead, briefly led, raced in the two path and between rivals, finished evenly. SARAH'S COURT vied for the lead, raced on the rail, took back and stalked, improved position, shifted out into the six path before the stretch, lost ground but still had momentum in the upper stretch, then faded. EMILY'S BULLET was off of the pace, stayed out in the five path, made on run and was able to pass rivals in the stretch. SAVED BY GRACE vied for the lead, took control and lead from the two path, shuffled in between foes and tired. GIRL LIKES BLING vied for the lead, then settled into a stalking, shuffled back the middle of the field, raced on the rail, saved ground through out but did not have enough today. REAL DEAL RYAN started off in the middle of the field, then shuffled into an off the pace, position and never got involved. RONNIE'S DEAL vied, led, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Court
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, took back, shifted 6 wide, upper, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Tap Galore
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, bid 3/8, circled set, 5 wide, upper, closed, up

ENTRY.NAME: Girl Likes Bling
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, rail, saved ground, not today

ENTRY.NAME: Real Deal Ryan
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, off pace, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Deal
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, circled, led 1/4, 4 wide, upper, drifted, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Viv's Wild Aces
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, circled, 5 wide, upper, better then the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Emily's Bullet
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Jr Gerald Deville Carl J Our Blue Streaks Stable and Pomier Chasey Deville

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Turf Classic S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1 1/16M Turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Free nomination. $250 to enter and an additional $250 to start. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 Guaranteed of which 60% to the wi nner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three years old 120lbs; Older 124lbs. Non-winners of $30,000 at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2lbs; two races other than maiden, claiming or starter at a mile or over in 2023 allow ed 4lbs; a race other than maiden, claiming or starter at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than twelve (12) pass the entry box, preference will be given to the horses with the highest earnings in 2022 - 2023. Different owners ha ve equal draw according to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw into the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Mo
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WOODS N WATER stalked the front runners on the rail, raced inside of the second flight of horses, had to rate, was behind horses through the turn, shifted out into the three path existing the turn, found a seem and gunned through taking the lead, had the lead and was in control and held sway. OH MY ACHING ARCH was off in the middle of the pack, raced in the two path, on the inside of the third flight of horses, stalked the eventual winner and followed hiim through the traffic in the turn, chased the eventual winner into the stretch, angled inside to avoid a tiring foe, closed while racing on the rail and got up for second. SILVER GALAXY raced off of the pace on the rail early on, made one run, split horses and gained ground after the half mile pole, angled intothe eight path is the upper stretch and closed well on the outside. REAL CITY SPEED stalked the pace in the three path, raced in between rivals, raced even in the stretch. BUDRO TALKING was off of the pace, settled and made one run, closed in the stretch. MONARCH'S MISCHIEF stalked the pace, raced in the four path, maintained position into the stretch then tired. CARLEA'S DREAM stalked the pace setter from the three path, was just off of the leader, took the lead and led bu the quarter pole, battled briefly then tired. SMARTY ALEX was never involved. BRITTS A CLOSER made no impact. ALLNIGHT MOONLIGHT mid pack, faded. HALF AGAIN raced on the rail, led while in hands then faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty Alex
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Kathy Eleven One Racing Stables LLC and Joe Hackler Racing LP

ENTRY.NAME: Oh My Aching Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Davis Wayne T and Wilson Rebecca
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, rated, 3rd flight, followed eventual winner, rail,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Galaxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, bid 1/2, split, angled 8wupper closed

ENTRY.NAME: Woods N Water
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, stalked, inside, angled out, 3 wide, upper, led, held sway

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Orange Grove Thoroughbreds, Inc. & Richard Painter

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Louisiana Cup Sprint S. LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 100. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Free nomination. $250 to enter and an additional $250 to pass the entry box. Supplementary nomination of $1,500 due at time of entry (includes entry and starting fees). $75,000 Guaranteed of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three Years Old 120lbs - Older 124lbs. Non-winners of $30,000 in 2023 allowed 2lbs; two races other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2023 allowed 4lbs; a race other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2023 allowed 6lbs. In the event that more than Twelve (12) pass the entry box, preference will be given to the horses with the highest earnings in 2022 - 2023. Different owners have equal draw according to earnings. The second part of same owner entries will have no consideration over a single interest. Failure to draw into the race cancels all fees. Louisiana Downs will present a trophy to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Monday July 24, 2023 with 27 Nominees.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: X CLOWN vied for the lead, took command and raced on the rail, was pressured through out with rivals on the outside, was in a three way battle at the five sixteenth pole, battled down the lane racing head to head, then found more late in th estretch and pulled away for the win. PICKENS raced from off of the pace, circled five wide in the turn, drifted out in the stretch, continued to closed and battled for the win but just missed late. MIKE J vied for the lead, end up stalking the leader briefly, drew next to the leader and challenged for the lead, battled then faded. BIG CHOPPER was off of the pace, raced wide, closed well in the stretch. WISE ANCHOR stalked the leader from the two path, was tucked in behind horses, then had no late kick. HELAIRE was off slow, made one run gained mildly. BLACK SWORD was off the pace and was never involved. STARPORT flashed early speed and faded. CHARLI MICHAEL was fast but faint early.

ENTRY.NAME: X Clown
ENTRY.OWNER: BW and HTS Stables LLC and Grudzien Jason G
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, inside advantage, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Helaire
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, one run, mild gain late

ENTRY.NAME: Pickens
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, circled 5w, drifted, closed, missed

RACE.FOOTNOTES: MS. CAJUN QUEEN was off mid pack, settled in hands, launched a bid at the three eights pole, led at the quarter and held on for the win. SCAMPERING GRAYCE vied for the lead, set the pace while racing on the rail, showed the to the quarter pole, was collared and chassed for second. GIRL THIRSTY raced off of the pace early, improved position, was in contention and was able to out finish the rest getting up for third. SIXTH ANNIVERSARY was off slow and out in a mild bid late. ANGELA'S CELERITY flashed early speed then tired. MISS KENNEDY mid pack then faltered. MEAN AMERICAN showed little. LITTLE E forwardly placed, gave way. BLESSED ANNA trailed through out.
